page.title: 05Worship
page.content: In the area there are many places where one can worship. For{Muslims} there is a mosque.{Manchester Road {Methodist Church}and{Baxenden {Methodist Church}provide local methodists with places to worship. The local{Roman Catholic}community have their own church and school, both called{St. Marys.}There are two Church of England churches, both with schools attached.{St. James}has the reputation of being the highest church, altitude that is, in Lancashire. It serves the town of Haslingden.{St. Johns, {Stonefold}is situated in the smaller residential area of Rising Bridge.Minority religions are also catered for in the area. There are two Baptist chapels,{"The Cave of Adullam" {Particular Baptist}and{The Holy {Baptist.}There is also a{Full Gospel {Church}and a{United Reformed Church.
